column4: So, I'm being a complete cretin. I'm trying to get wireless working on my laptop (I've never bothered in the past). All the information out there these days basically says "Click on NetworkManager and it just works". Unfortunately a) I can't find NetworkManager *anywhere* in the interface and b) When I try to run it from the console it demands to be run as root, yet when I run it as root it returns instantly and doesn't do a blasted thing
What am I missng?
(I'm running hardy heron)
what version of ubuntu?
Hardy Heron
ok, then can you see the network icon up near the clock?
Yes. It seems to only list wired networks
Ah. Is that the fabled NetworkManager I should be looking at? This isn't obvious from any of the UI info it provides. :)
then it probably cannot see your wireless card so you will need drivers. what card do you have?
The proprietary hardware drivers menu suggests that "Support for Atheros 802.11 wirless LAN cards" is installed, enabled and in use
odd, right click on the nm-applet icon (the network icon you checked before) and make sure wireless is enabled
The enable networking checkbox? It's ticked
run lspci and pastebin the output
02:00.0 Ethernet controller: Atheros Communications Inc. AR242x 802.11abg Wireless PCI Express Adapter (rev 01) <- that is your wireless
and you black listed ath5k and installed madwifi?
ok, there are two atheros drivers. madwifi which is stable, works but is proprietary and ath5k which is new, fast, cool, open but doesn't work on all hardware
can you pastebin the output from lsmod please?
http://pastebin.com/f1b9e4e02
and now can you pastebin the output of ifconfig pls
Thanks very much for your help.
that's ok, I didn't do much tbh :) gladit is working
You spent time helping me. That counts for a fair bit in my book regardless of what was achieved. :)
it's more interesting than work atm (writing test cases isn't the most exciting)
Heh. I find writing test cases kindof satisfying sometimes.
